results.title: Director, Sales
results.description:
Sora is seeking a Director of Sales to coach our Sales team and build out/hone our sales processes, team, and culture.

 

About Sora

Sora’s mission is to empower people-focused teams to create exceptional employee experiences. These teams should be spending time with people, but unfortunately all facets of People teams are bogged down by managing processes instead of helping people. That’s where Sora comes in: we’re building a product that streamlines the tedious and repetitive work People teams do every day, from sending emails to assigning onboarding tasks to a new hire’s manager to syncing data across anywhere from 3 to 20 tools in a customer’s HR stack.

We’re a pure startup, with all the excitement that carries as a foundational member, but with more thoughtfulness than the typical early-stage company. We’re committed to our values and we take our mission seriously. Employee experience is in our DNA — we invest in processes that are inclusive and fair, and we invest in our long-term mental, physical, and emotional health.

Sora was founded in late 2018 and launched in 2020. We’ve fundraised from some of the best investors in the world and prioritize keeping a diverse group of investors and advisors.

Sora is committed to being a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical disability, or length of time spent unemployed.

 

About the team

Our Sales team is full of good listeners and problem solvers. We’re lucky to work with and sell to empathetic, thoughtful people that are bought into our mission and committed to making a difference for employees at their companies. We sell by building relationships with great people and being genuine about how we can solve real problems for them.

 

We get to work closely with every single team at Sora to inform our product roadmap, ensure a smooth transition from sales to customer onboarding, help marketing with messaging that resonates with customers, and more.

 

We live all over the country and (outside of COVID) love to get together for board games, surfing, cooking, Mario Kart, and more :)

 

About the role

Sora has lots of early signs of product/market fit (e.g., we have amazing logos that rave about us and have produced some great case studies), and we have a huge opportunity to solidify our place in the HR tech market and grow exponentially from here.

 

To do this, you’ll work with our CEO (our Head of Sales) to own the entire sales funnel, working to meet our goals by optimizing and finding repeatability in all parts of the sales process. You’ll create and iterate on a sales process that is consistent and scalable, from prospecting to closing. You’ll manage our existing team of two BDRs, one AE, and one Sales Engineer — coaching and motivating them to success. You’ll own sales forecasting, and ensure that the Sales team and the rest of the organization has access to our Sales metrics (defined and monitored by you) and understands how we’re tracking toward our goals. And as we’re ready to scale, you’ll get to recruit and ramp a team full of empathetic, relationship-building, passionate salespeople.

 

You’ll learn the ins and outs of our product and speak to customers so you can keep a pulse on our process and suggest improvements. And you’ll interface with every department at Sora: 

  • You’ll work with Marketing to work on messaging, lead qualification, targeting optimization, etc. 

  • You’ll work with Customer Success to ensure smooth customer onboarding handoffs and make sure customers are set up for success from the beginning. 

  • You’ll be proactive and communicative about all prospective customer needs, working closely with the Product team, so we can be constantly evaluating and improving our product/market fit.

 

You’ll be the #1 advocate for Sora externally and steer the revenue ship to our success!

 

Behaviors we’re looking for

  • Owning outbound strategies to increase our top of funnel

  • Excellent management skills, including a ton of coaching and delivering candid and helpful feedback

  • Willingness to get your hands dirty: joining calls, understanding the product and our value proposition inside and out, reading contracts closely, and showing the team what it means to work smart

  • Introducing rigor into our processes and thinking about how we can iterate (first with lowest hanging fruit then anything else we can) to increase our conversion rates at every step and create a repeatable process

     

Relevant experience

  • 2+ years sales management experience

  • Direct SaaS closing experience

  • Experience with a wide range of ACVs ($10K-100K+)

  • Experience using, designing, and generating reporting through Salesforce

  • Proven track record of meeting and/or exceeding revenue quotas

  • Experience at early and middle stage startups

 

Benefits

  • Comprehensive health coverage ($0 deductible PPO plans): Sora covers 99% of individual monthly premiums for all employees, and 50% of dependent monthly premiums.

  • 401(k) with 3% direct company contribution: Sora deposits 3% of an employee's annual salary into their 401k, regardless of whether the employee is making individual contributions or not (so, essentially this is free money!).

  • Remote-first culture: A flexible work environment enabling our people to to do their best work.

  • Unlimited paid time off: We highly encourage at least 4-6 weeks.

  • $300/month Flexible Remote Work Stipend: These funds can be used towards a variety of remote work expenses.

  • Commuter benefits: To use if you're commuting to/from a co-working space.

  • Parental leave: 16 weeks of fully paid parental leave to all parents (regardless of family formation) with the option to extend 1 additional month at reduced pay.

  • In-person co-working weeks and retreats: 3 times a year we offer the opportunity for everyone to get together in-person in a different city in the US. Most recently, we brought folks to Austin for our annual retreat!

  • Ginger or Headspace: Anyone enrolled in Sora's health insurance should have access to a choice of either Ginger OR Headspace through Blue Shield.

  • Maven: Anyone enrolled in Sora's health insurance plans through Blue Shield should have access to Maven, an app that offers comprehensive care for everyone planning, starting, and raising a family.

  • Monthly stipend for coffee chats: We keep you connected with your co-workers by facilitating random pairings and encouraging you to meet (remotely ) for coffee, lunch, or donuts.

     

Ready to apply?

If you share our values and feel this role could be for you, we’d love to review your application! We promise we do take the time and care to review every application we receive. However, as much as we wish we could interview everyone who submits an application, we cannot guarantee an interview or feedback due to the volume of applications we are receiving today. We are rooting for you, and hope you do consider applying.

Note: You'll need valid U.S. work authorization to join us. 

Please note that a background check and employment verification will be required for this position. We may obtain one or more background screening reports about you, solely for employment purposes.

results.title: Product Manager
results.description:
About LeadIQ

LeadIQ makes sales teams more efficient. With our solutions you can identify and capture your prospect data, track sales triggers and compose compelling messages. Read more about us on LeadIQ.com

Overview

We are looking for a Product Manager to join our flagship product team. We are at the inflexion point for growth, and we need strong Product Managers who can help us drive forward. As a PM at LeadIQ, you should be comfortable in a hands-on, collaborative and flexible environment, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while driving towards aggressive goals to be successful in this role.

As a PM, you will direct product development and ensure high return on investment (ROI). You’ll translate ideas into strategy and features, and follow product development from start to finish. You will be a guiding force for some of the key initiatives in the product segment, driving significant growth. This is a 100% remote role and requires partnering with our diverse and distributed teams based across APAC and Europe.

 

The Role

The Product Manager will be the "owner" of our core product experience - workflow, which includes features such as automation, notifications, my Accounts, and the "glue" of our LeadIQ platform. In this role, the key focus will be to:

  • Conceptualise, launch and optimise products and features, experiment, test their performance and iterate quickly

  • Specify product requirements in a clear manner and work with engineers to deliver on specification

  • Develop product roadmaps and build alignment across product teams, cross-functional partners, and leadership team

  • Own product metrics, analysing data and reporting

  • Understanding and meeting customer needs with a knack for UX

  • Communicate seamlessly and collaborate with a cross-functional team of engineering, design, and product

 

The Person

  • 4+ years of Product Management experience, preferably in B2B segment

  • Have experience in B2B sales enterprise software or familiarity with Sales team structures and workflows

  • Proven track record of translating customer pains into product features, delivering delightful customer experiences that drive business results

  • Excellent problem-solving, organisational and analytical skills coupled with overall good communication and presentation skills

  • Highly collaborative and comfortable executing in a cross-functional, a matrix environment

  • Working experience of a high-growth startup / a similar setup will be an advantage

  • Prior work experience and/or education in Computer Science or engineering capacity; MBA or advanced degree a plus

 

About Us

LeadIQ is a Series B-funded startup headquartered in the Bay Area and Singapore. We are reshaping the future of Sales with our mission to enable the day-to-day sales prospecting workflow for every sales rep.

We are passionate about empowering our customers with Data and Insights to generate more revenue faster. We do this with the help of cutting-edge technologies and innovation.

A diverse and talented workforce powers our exponential growth across 30+ countries that breathe our core values of #EmpathyFirst, #BeBetterEveryday, #DataDriven, and #MakeItHappen, and the trust of our investors- Cathay Innovation, Fresco Capital, Strong Ventures, Eight Roads, Draper Associates, and Jason Calacanis.

We are a remote-first company with a culture of trust, independence, and collaboration striving to transform Sales. Join us!

 

LeadIQ is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, education status, or any other legally protected status.

results.title: Digital Marketing Executive
results.description:
About us

JayWay Travel is a well-established and rapidly growing travel company that specializes in creating fully customized experiences for our clients travelling throughout Europe. Our company has been arranging unique travel experiences since 2006, and we have been named in publications such as Travel+Leisure, the New York Times, USA Today and National Geographic.

About the Role

Digital Marketing Executive for JayWay Travel, a custom tour operator is creating tours in Europe for travellers from long-haul markets such as the US, Canada, and Australia. We are seeking an experienced Digital Marketing Executive who has a creative flair, someone who lives and breathes digital marketing and is ready to get involved in all aspects of marketing. Preferably within the Travel and Leisure industry but we are open to considering candidates from different backgrounds too. The primary focus will be on developing, implementing, tracking and optimising our digital marketing campaigns across all digital channels. Part of this role will involve managing a small but tightly-knit Marketing Team, under the leadership of our Head of Business Development. People skills and good team management skills are essential.  We are a growing company and as we grow some of the following tasks will be divided within the wider team. The ideal candidate will be a dynamic individual who thrives working remotely with cross-functional teams to achieve our ambitious 2023 and beyond marketing goals and objectives. The role is fully remote but must be within CET. 

Responsibilities

  • Day-to-day management of the marketing team ensuring projects are moving forward and overall team performance is being monitored
  • You keep everyone informed of the marketing plans and are the go-to person for any internal marketing-related questions or requests
  • Contribute to planning and overseeing the execution of all digital marketing, including SEO/SEM, email, social media and display advertising campaigns
  • Measure and report the performance of all digital marketing campaigns, and assess against goals (ROI and KPIs)
  • Identify trends and insights, and optimize spend and performance based on the insights
  • Brainstorm new and creative growth strategies
  • Plan, execute, and measure experiments and conversion tests
  • Collaborate with internal teams to create landing pages and optimize the user experience
  • Instrument conversion points and optimizes user funnels
  • Collaborate with agencies and other vendor partners
  • Evaluate emerging technologies. Provide thought leadership and perspective for adoption where appropriate

 

Requirements and skills

 

  • BS/MS degree in marketing or a related field
  • Experience managing colleagues on a project basis, or as direct reports
  • Proven working experience in digital marketing ( 5+ years)
  • Demonstrable experience leading and managing SEO/SEM, marketing database, email, social media, and display advertising campaigns
  • Highly creative with experience in identifying target audiences and devising digital campaigns that engage, inform and motivate
  • Experience in optimizing landing pages and user funnels
  • Experience with A/B and multivariate experiments
  • Experience in setting up and optimizing Google Adwords campaigns
  • Solid knowledge of website analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics 4)
  • Working knowledge of display and native programmatic advertising platforms
  • Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript development and constraints
  • Strong analytical skills and data-driven thinking
  • Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in online marketing and measurement

Perks

  • Competitive pay
  • Fully remote-work position but must operate in CET
  • Company MacBook and iPhone provided
  • Travel opportunities
  • Training in Europe
  • Performance bonuses

Please answer the following questions in the form of a cover letter:

  • What skills do you have that would make you the best fit for the position?
  • Could you share some of your proudest achievements in Digital Marketing?
  • What are some essential tools on your digital marketing tool belt?
  • What about JayWay Travel interests you in joining our team?

If interested in the position, please send your CV and a cover letter per instructions.

We are very excited to hear from you!

results.title: Contact Center Consultant
results.description:
B2B tech company is seeking a Contact Center Consultant to join their team!

WHAT WE DO

At Cloud Revolution, our focus is inspired by our clients' complex communication challenges. We're advocates, champions, experts, and kindred spirits in the cloud platforms in which they architect their futures. We provide the expertise to streamline and accelerate our clients' reality of a robust cloud ecosystem, including advanced capabilities and specializations. And we're FastTrack-ready.

From its inception, Cloud Revolution has focused on this opportunity and gathered talent to offer these deep and unique Teams-centric capabilities to the market. And we've never looked back.

THE OPPORTUNITY
Cloud Revolution is seeking an organized, helpful, and passionate problem solver who enjoys understanding business challenges and solving them with technology. The right person for this role is naturally an excellent listener, enjoys inventing solutions to unique challenges, and at the same time can push projects and tasks to completion, works independently, and is eager to learn about a variety of Microsoft Teams certified contact center solutions such as Anywhere 365, 8x8, TalkDesk, and Genesys. 

The primary job focus is to implement contact center solutions for external clients and resolve associated issues with contact center performance. Experience implementing Microsoft Teams is a plus. While we already have a team of experienced consultants, we will be adding new vendors and so this role may need to help figure out how to deliver new technologies within an existing framework. 

We all work from home across the country. To be successful in this role, you will need to be able to stay motivated and engaged in a remote environment and be comfortable using video and voice calls, instant messaging, and email to stay connected. We try to get together in person at least once a year.

WHAT YOU WILL DO

  • Meet with customer to understand their challenges around contact center and the caller experience.
  • Understand and communicate reporting needs surrounding contact center performance.
  • Implement and configure a variety of contact center solutions such as Anywhere 365, 8x8, TalkDesk, and/or Genesys for external clients within budget and schedule constraints.
  • Regularly attend training courses and webinars to increase experience and knowledge surrounding contact center (may be remote or in person).
  • As time allows, build knowledge of Microsoft Teams voice solutions and participate in Microsoft Teams Voice project work. 
  • Document issue resolutions in a knowledge base and regularly share that knowledge with the rest of the team.
  • Participate in rotating on-call schedule.
  • As time allows, work on specific project tasks as assigned by the team lead.
  • Travel to company events up to a couple times a year and to client sites as needed. Anticipated travel is up to 10% within the United States.

WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO OUR ORGANIZATION 

  • 3+ years' experience with basic networking, routing, and switching, Active Directory, Contact Center, or Microsoft Teams combined with a natural understanding of how to troubleshoot a problem. 
  • 3+ years' experience working as a contact center agent or supervisor, executive assistant, or other role that makes heavy use of advanced phone features. Able to explain the different types of transfers, what call park is, and features such as barge and whisper, callback, reason codes, etc. 
  • 3+ years' experience working with external customers, partners, and vendors.
  • Open and professional communication skills are required; you'll be working with world-class project managers and clients.
  • Excellent business English skills, with ability to talk competently and professionally with vendors, end users, and technical SMEs.
  • Desire and willingness to take certification coursework. Some may be required, others you may want to pursue with our support.
  • Understanding the importance of accepting and contributing feedback in order to grow as a team and individual.
  • Growth mindset and capability to learn quickly and independently. 

The successful candidate:

  • Enjoys operating with humans at the center, and therefore naturally possesses excellent customer service and hospitality skills.
  • Has a passion for listening to business challenges and solving them with technology.
  • Enjoys learning new technologies and building best practices around their implementation.
  • Is a Self-Starter who loves to figure things out and can balance that desire with excellent judgement as to when to ask for help or admit a mistake.
  • Having experience with a business intelligence reporting tool such as PowerBI, QlikView, or Tableau is a plus. 
  • Having experience in a business analysis role is a plus.

WHAT OUR ORGANIZATION IS PROVIDING

  • Expected annual salary range of $90,000 - $115,000
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance
  • 401(k)
  • Paid time off starting at 15 days annually 
  • 48 hours of sick time off annually.
  • 10+ paid holidays.

Cloud Revolution provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, genetics, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. In addition to federal law requirements, Cloud Revolution complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. 

Cloud Revolution will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants for failing to disclose wage rate history in accordance with applicable law. 

Cloud Revolution expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Cloud Revolution employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

results.title: Data Engineer
results.description:
About us

Viable Data is an innovative technology, data and UX consultancy, delivering excellence through our projects and providing our people with a supportive culture and opportunities for growth and continuous learning.

We thrive on the challenge of working across different projects, user needs and technologies and our teams and people live this every day. Our people-first approach and culture is central to our growing success as a consultancy.

We are an all-inclusive equal opportunities employer and proudly celebrate diversity. If you thrive on challenge, have a passion to learn and make a difference, and enjoy being part of a growing multidisciplinary team, look no further and start your Viable career, now.

About the role

As a Data Engineer at Viable Data, you will be at the forefront to ensure that data is in the right state and format, ready to implement data schemas and models, making sure that the data is ready and available for data mining purposes.

You will be someone who can adapt quickly and easily to the flexible needs of our Central Government customers. You will join one of our high-performing consulting teams where you will play a pivotal role in designing & delivering exceptional digital products and services that directly contribute to the delivery of UK policy, economic growth and security.

This role is largely remote with occasional business essential travel.

Requirements

Key responsibilities

  • Experience of pragmatic, hands-on analysis of enterprise-scale data projects across the full SDLC from design to migration, integration and live service in an Agile environment • Experience of analysis and design of solutions using one or more from: SQL and noSQL technologies, data streaming, logging and monitoring tools, BI and Data Warehousing solutions and ETL and migration technologies
  • A thorough understanding of one or more from: Master Data Management, Data Lineage analysis, Metadata Management, Data Quality assessment and management, Data Transformation and migration
  • Ability to apply advanced analytics and statistics techniques to business problems
  • Proven experience of working with large volumes of data, applying tools such as SAS, R, Python, SQL, PowerBI, Tableau, Looker
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to tell stories / influence with data

Skills and experience needed

  • Proven relevant industry experience.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication abilities - presenting findings and related design/business recommendations and insights clearly that stakeholders can understand and use. Able to communicate with stakeholders at all levels.
  • Proven analysis skills - experience of various data analysis methods at enterprise scale
  • People skills – empathetic, great listener and have a natural curiosity to understand people, their motivations and thought processes.
  • Experience and understanding of a range of User Centred Design practices
  • Organisation, time management and collaboration skills

Benefits

Why work with us?

As well as providing a great place to work that has an amazing culture and the opportunity to work on excellent projects where you will really make a difference, we have a whole host of additional employee benefits.

Our benefits package includes:

  • 25 days leave
  • 5 days dedicated training allowance, with individual budget
  • Mentoring system, with 6-month review cycles
  • Flexible hours and supportive of remote working
  • 5% pension company contributions
  • Annual bonus based on company performance
  • Choice of company laptop (Macbook, Windows)

results.title: Managing Editor of Local
results.description:
Capital B is a first-of-its-kind local and national nonprofit news organization reporting for Black communities across the country. We're looking for an experienced editor who is committed to community journalism to manage our expanding network of local newsrooms.
Capital B's managing editor of local will have the rare opportunity to build a collection of newsrooms in Black communities across the country that are underserved by local news. This is a senior editorial position in the Capital B organization, and this editor's primary responsibility is to support our local newsroom editors and their teams as they execute Capital B's mission — to produce high-quality civic and explanatory journalism that centers Black Americans — for their unique local audiences.
The ideal candidate will be a builder with experience establishing or expanding teams. They will work with senior leaders to identify locations for newsrooms, hire staff, oversee their development, and establish them as trusted sources of news and information in their communities. This person must be comfortable working with editors and reporters from a variety of backgrounds and with various experience levels, developing them in the practice of community-centered reporting. 
This is an exciting and critical role at a time when local news sources are in decline nationwide. If you're passionate about developing creative, community-driven solutions for Black news consumers across the country, this could be the job for you.
The position reports to the editorial director.
Salary: $120,000-$140,000
Location: Remote
Responsibilities: 
  • Oversee the development and success of a growing network of local newsrooms, starting with Capital B Atlanta
  • Work with a matrix of organization leaders to research and strategize for new local market launches
  • Manage hiring, training and development of local newsroom staffs
  • Maintain editorial standards in alignment with Capital B's mission of civic and community journalism across the network
  • Collaborate with other departments on editorial programming for live events
  • Work with other leaders on partnerships, collaborations and community engagement
  • Occasional assigning and editing news stories
What you'll bring: 
  • A deep interest in Black media and serving Black news consumers
  • 5+ years of editing experience and 3+ years of management experience — experience managing other editors is a plus
  • Demonstrated passion for community and civic journalism
  • Experience working with new reporters and interest in developing them
  • An openness to nontraditional approaches to journalism
  • An extreme audience focus — Capital B's work is not for industry peers or awards committees, although it's a plus if they like it!
  • Empathy, kindness and patience
What we'll bring:
  • A compassionate, supportive workplace 
  • Unlimited PTO + company holidays
  • 20 weeks parental leave
  • 12 weeks caregiver leave
  • 401K
  • Dental, health, and vision insurance
  • Life insurance
  • Health and dependent care flex plans
  • Short-term disability
  • Professional development fund
  • Monthly phone and internet stipend
  • Stipend for home office setup
Please submit your resume and a brief cover note explaining why you're a good fit for this role. The deadline for applications is January 20. Capital B is open to candidates with a diversity of experience, and we know that some very strong candidates won't have all the qualifications we list. Don't be shy — apply!

results.title: ACCOUNTANT CPA
results.description:
Company Description

Our Firm is a team of  Experts, caring and transparent. Our Firm is structured to provide leadership in achieving high quality professional performance while maintaining the concept of individual responsibility. We require high level problem solving abilities, broad software knowledge, and excellent written and oral communication skills. We have a team approach to provide high quality client service for tax compliance, planning, financial statements, and general business consulting.



Job Description

Responsibilities vary depending on level of experience.  Training is available for entry level. Those with experience will be responsible for preparing individual, corporate, partnership, non-profit and trust tax returns.



Qualifications

Must have experience with QuickBooks Desktop and QuickBooks Online. Experience with CCH ProSystem fx is a plus.  Experience preparing financial statements is a plus.

Must have strong communication, customer relationship and time management skills and the ability to work independently and meet deadlines.

Must be a CPA with verifiable licensure via DOBHR. Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in accounting is required. 

Highly competitive salary, outstanding benefits package including some relocation assistance from within the Continental United States. Clear growth path. Flexible scheduling including limited remote work. Must be authorized to work for any employer in the United States without sponsorship now and in the future.

***RECRUITERS, BPO AND OUTSOURCING COMPANIES DON'T CONTACT OUR FIRM, IF DO WE WILL REPORT YOU TO SPAM!!! ***

CANDIDATES ONLY, APPLY.



Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

results.title: VFX artist
results.description:
Company Description

Covenant is an indie creative house offering well-executed, fresh gameplay experiences. The company works only on original, proprietary IPs and greatly relies on employee empowerment to develop those brands into globally recognizable franchises. It is also the first polish gamedev that earned the title of the 'Best Place to Work' in Poland (2021). 

Currently, the company is developing "Gord" - a single-player, adventure-strategy game featuring developing societies, eerie forbidden lands, and remarkable mythical creatures.



Job Description
  • Creating real-time special effects (ie. environment effects, flames, dust, fog, water, blood etc.)
  • Creating components such as textures, materials, meshes, liquid simulations etc.
  • Creating special effects from a concept to the final version
  • Optimizing and debugging existing VFX



Qualifications
  • At least a year of experience in a related or similar position.  
  • Strong experience with Unreal Engine 4, including using tools related to materials and VFXes 
  • Good knowledge of composition, color theory & lighting.

  • Experience with various software packages including Maya, Photoshop, Zbrush / Mudbox, Substance Designer.

  • Passion for games.
  • Advanced English language skills.



Additional Information
  • Long-term, remote work relationship with a small, indie studio.
  • Highest organizational standards with a strong emphasis on strategic planning.

results.title: Senior Product Designer
results.description:
About us:

Fieldguide is establishing a new state of trust for global commerce and capital markets through automating and streamlining the work of assurance and audit practitioners specifically within cybersecurity, privacy, and ESG (Environmental, Social, Governance). Put simply, we build software for the people who enable trust between businesses. 

‍

We’re based in San Francisco, CA, but built as a remote-first company that enables you to do your best work from anywhere. We're backed by top investors including 8VC, Floodgate, Y Combinator, DNX Ventures, Global Founders Capital, Justin Kan, Eric Ries, and more.

 

We value diversity — in backgrounds and in experiences. We need people from all backgrounds and walks of life to help build the future of audit and advisory. Fieldguide’s team is inclusive, driven, humble and supportive. We are deliberate and self-reflective about the kind of team and culture that we are building, seeking teammates that are not only strong in their own aptitudes but care deeply about supporting each other's growth.

 

As an early stage start-up employee, you’ll have the opportunity to build out the future of business trust. We make audit practitioners’ lives easier by eliminating up to 50% of their work and giving them better work-life balance. If you share our values and enthusiasm for building a great culture and product, you will find a home at Fieldguide.

‍Responsibilities

  • Deeply understand our customers and their workflows.

  • Establish and guide the end-to-end design process for the lifecycle of products and features, from user research, to conceptualization, to launch, to product iteration.

  • Set the bar for the design organization by building a trusting partnership with product and engineering and providing mentorship and guidance to junior designers.

  • Bring first principles thinking and a focus on continuous improvement to your design work. You’ll be helping us challenge the status quo in the industry and making our products and processes better over time.

The following should describe you

  • 3-5+ years of experience as a product designer on SaaS products with a heavy focus on workflows and complex data.

  • Excitement to work on cybersecurity and financial products that make complex standards easier for companies to access and manage. Bonus if you have experience working on security, compliance, or accounting-related products.

  • Experience leading customer research sessions, aggregating insights, and communicating findings to product managers, engineers, and executives.

  • Ability to establish and lead design systems that span across features and products.

  • Ability to work iteratively, mapping user journeys, and taking design concepts from low fidelity wireframes to full Figma prototypes as necessary

  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with a track record of cross-functional collaboration.

  • Excitement to shape the culture and processes of a young design organization.

 
More about Fieldguide:

Fieldguide is a values-based company. Our values are:

  • Fearless - Inspire & break down seemingly impossible walls.

  • Fast - Launch fast with excellence, iterate to perfection.

  • Lovable - ​​Deliver happiness & 11 star experiences. 

  • Owners - Execute & run the business with ownership.

  • Win-win - Create mutual value & earn trust for life. 

  • Inclusive - Scale the best ideas with inclusive teams. 

 

Some of our benefits include: 

  • Competitive compensation packages with meaningful ownership

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Wellness benefits, including a bundle of free therapy sessions

  • 401k

  • Technology & Work from Home reimbursement

  • Flexible work schedules

results.title: Customer Service Representative
results.description:
Job Description

The Customer Service Representative is responsible for acting as the primary point of contact for customers, ensuring a timely and professional response to incoming customer calls and orders. You will answer incoming customer calls in a prompt and professional manner, and will communicate effectively with customers to ensure accuracy and quality of customer account information and customer order data. You will also demonstrate the ability to effectively maneuver through appropriate system screens, utilize available department tools and information, and request assistance as needed.

Job Details:

Customer Service Representative

Work from home

Shifting Schedule

*We are looking for someone who is amenable to work on any shift.

Responsibilities

·  Acts as the primary point of contact for customer orders, ensuring a timely and professional response to incoming customer calls/orders.

results.title: (Senior) Growth Marketing Manager (F/M/D)
results.description:
THE ROLE

remberg's mission is to help companies manage their things such as machines & equipment in the cloud and digitize associated processes in service, sales and marketing. Thereby we get rid of paper and Excel while laying the groundwork for the age of IoT. We are building the remberg XRM - a new category in SaaS that reinvents the logic of CRM by placing things at the core, not customers. We raised our EUR 11 Million Series A Round from renowned investors and business angels from five different Unicorns (including Personio, Celonis, UiPath, Forto, Aiven) and are now looking for an ambitious and talented (Senior) Growth Marketing Manager (F/M/D).

You like a challenging, fast-paced environment, and you have already proven in a similar position that you work independently, reliably, and in a structured manner? Then keep on reading.

Get on board in leading businesses into the digital future, help build a fast-growing start-up and set new marketing standards in the B2B world:

As (Senior) Growth Marketing Manager (F/M/D) you will be at the forefront of remberg's marketing initiatives. In this position, you will generate and convert qualified leads and ultimately fill our sales pipeline. You'll build omnichannel strategies that target key stakeholders across the entire marketing funnel, test advertising campaigns, and build a robust analytics framework to iterate and improve results constantly. You will work closely with our Head of Marketing to ensure we're aligned and hit our growth goals.

 

 

 

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
  • You generate demand through paid advertising channels (Google, Facebook, LinkedIn, etc.) and optimize our channels to fill the sales pipeline while supported by our dedicated Design team
  • You own the complete marketing conversion funnel, including nurturing leads and ensuring a smooth handover to Sales
  • You discover and experiment with new promotional channels to expand our target audience reach
  • You coordinate with the Sales team on current needs and launch account-based strategies to target key stakeholders across the entire funnel
  • You build a robust analytics framework to measure, test, and refine our strategies to meet our goals

 

 

YOUR PROFILE
  • 3+ years experience in Demand Gen and a track record of data-driven improvements (B2B SaaS experience is a plus)
  • Extensive proficiency in developing effective marketing campaigns and a successful track record
  • You bring experience working with Google Analytics, LinkedIn, Facebook/Instagram, Google Ads, Zapier, and Hubspot or a subset thereof 
  • Good project management skills and ability to work with multiple stakeholders in a fast-paced environment
  • You show strong ownership when managing your projects and the ability to pivot when things don't go to plan
  • You have excellent analytical skills and can quickly learn while having an impeccable eye for detail
  • You embrace feedback - no one is perfect, and neither are we. So let's make this an opportunity to praise and learn from each other
  • You are fluent in English (written and spoken, C1 level); German is a plus

We know not everyone is perfect, so if you do not meet all criteria, don't worry. We are looking forward to your application!

 

 

WHY REMBERG

The rembears are a colorful, ambitious, value-driven bunch of problem-solving champions, software-engineering masters, sales machines, customer darlings, design fanatics, product visionaries, sporting aces, beer pong kings & queens and more. In short: you should get to know us.

Apart from that, there are even more reasons to join us:

  • With remberg, you bet on the right horse - not only you but also many renowned investors believe in us, such as Earlybird, Speedinvest, Fly Ventures, as well as business angels from five different Unicorns (including Personio, Celonis, UiPath, Forto, Aiven)
  • You get the chance to help build a fast-growing startup. Many processes are still changing or are not yet as they should be. This is your opportunity to have a big impact on remberg's development and success
  • It is motivating to see that our solution helps companies in the ‘Mittelstand' to do their tasks better, easier, faster every single day and that it prepares them for the digital future
  • You can work from wherever you want, as long as you can achieve your tasks. Whatever works for you works for us (e.g. Workation, Remote, Hybrid, etc.)
  • You get 30 vacation days and up to 3 full months workation per year
  • Decide if you want Urban Sports Club membership, JobRad, GuudCard, or financial support with your mobility costs, take care of your mental health with a free nilo.health-subscription and save efficiently for your retirement with our corporate pension plan (bAV)
  • You will receive your annual personal development budget of 1,500 euros, which you can use as you wish, whether a language course, advanced training, or online courses
  • We have short decision-making processes, promising career opportunities, team events, of course, a foosball table, a very nice espresso machine, and much more

 

ABOUT US

remberg is a fast-growing start-up from Munich, building the XRM software, a new kind of solution for companies to digitize processes around 'things', such as equipment, machines, plants, and vehicles - the groundwork for the age of the Internet of Things (IoT).

About

At Specify, we help organizations distribute their brand identity within their design system.

Specify is the first Design Data Platform that collects, stores and distributes design tokens and assets in a design system — automatically.

After years of user research, market analysis & product validations, we are now ready to scale the solution globally. That's why we are seeking the best talents out there... Maybe you are one of them!

We are product maniacs and a design centric startup.Yes it still exists. If you like Ops, APIs, Design & Dev Tools, and Open Source then you should love Specify! We are looking for people driven by strong product values ready to shape the next generation of Design API.

 

Job Description

Working with the company's team, you will help our growing engineering team to shape the future of Specify by developing the best solution to help our users to create, maintain and distribute their design system.


On a daily basis your job will consist in:

  • Designing and developing new features taking into account Specify's users’ feedback
  • Supporting product team by building internal tools and libraries
  • Be responsible for the code quality by reviewing the code, writing tests, and establishing new processes
  • In association with the other teams, you will bring your technical expertise to prioritize tasks and features
  • Being proactive in the maintenance and evolution of the technical stack


You will work on every backend part of our Information System. Be it on:

  • The microservices that collect, store, transform and deliver design datas and assets
  • The integrations with other tools of the ecosystem such as Figma, GitHub, Azure DevOps, etc
  • The internal libraries to improve our developer experience
  • The infrastructure to build scalable and highly available services
  • The public API
  • The implementation of our design system format specification


You will also work on clients parts:

  • The CLI client used to deal with Specify
  • The SDK will be used to improve the developer experience

 

Our current stack and tools

Main language

  • Both the front-end and the back-end are in TypeScript.
  • For maintenance and homogeneity purposes, we use TypeScript whenever it is possible. It simplifies the onboarding of any new developer and eases our code readability.

Frameworks

  • For the backend side, we use a couple NodeJS / FastifyJS. We also have some services with HapiJS.
  • For the communication between microservices, we use queues through SQS and RabbitMQ. For the synchronous request we use basic HTTP requests or TRPC when it’s necessary.
  • We leverage on AWS to manage clusters through services like ECS, Code pipeline, RDS (PostgreSQL), AmazonMQ…
  • The frontend part is built with Vue3.

Product tools

  • We use git flow to manage our branches and GitHub for reviews.
  • The CI/CD is managed with CircleCI to launch tests executed with Vitest.
  • To communicate and manage projects, we use Linear, Notion, Thread, and Gather.

Requirements

  • At least 3 years as a developer, a previous experience in a startup environment is an advantage
  • Strong knowledge in TypeScript.
  • Strong knowledge in Docker, network tools (RabbitMQ, kafka...), and databases (PostgreSQL, Redis...)
  • Strong knowledge with Git (branch, rebase, cherry-pick, squash, submodule...)
  • Full professional English capacities
  • Full capacity to work and improve workflow in a monorepo environment
  • Ability to work in the French timezone

Benefits

You'll work in a remote-friendly environment with passionate and talented people. You will have the chance to shape the future of collaboration between product teams.

  • ... A warm seat is always available at our HQ in Paris
  • We offer a complete remote working pack (laptop, chair, tools etc.)

However - if you feel like you're a perfect fit with any of the other verticals, don't hesitate to submit your application either way!

 

About INDG

At INDG we develop technology that enables engaging, hyper-realistic digital product experiences. Our goal is to make "every product playable", by combining the science of technology with the artistry of computer-generated content. Our offices are in Amsterdam and Bucharest and we have an ever-growing team of remote workers from different areas of the world – the US, Singapore, Brazil, South Africa.. Clients include Adidas, The North Face, Hillrom, Yamaha, Philips and more. Our CG artists, interactive designers, and developers focus on creating virtual versions of our clients' products, so lifelike it feels like you could reach out and touch them. Our culture brings together creative, tech and business individuals. It’s a heady cocktail that keeps us inspired, empowered and passionate.

What will you do?

  • Create CG content for stills 
  • Produce renders that combine realism, creativity and beauty
  • Contribute to our never-ending journey of quality improvement
  • Be involved and think-along on ways to improve workflows and processes
  • Train, coach & educate junior artists of our team

Would be amazing if you have

  • Excellent artistic skills with an emphasis on photorealistic product visualization and rendering animations
  • Know-how on basic mechanical-animations
  • You will have both an artistic eye and know how to use technology
  • Experience with 3DsMax, Photoshop, Aftereffects and Vray
  • Passion for digital product design

 

What we offer

This is a remote friendly role. Most of us work from Amsterdam or Bucharest, and if you’re close to any of the two, we’re more than happy to welcome you in our offices.

 

Working at INDG Grip means you’ll be supported with flexible working agreements, an annual L&D budget, mental health and gym benefits, paid annual leave and the right IT equipment for the job. For those working from our office, we offer a well-equipped kitchen with snacks, fruits, lunch, and creative workspaces.

 

How to apply

You can apply via the link below. Please be aware that we ask you to send your (up-to-date) CV and portfolio along with your application.

results.description:
Is remote working for you? At Catchpoint, we offer the flexibility to work where you want. If you want opportunities to learn, advance your career, take the initiative, and be challenged in new ways — you’ve come to the right job post.

Catchpoint is a global leader in observability, with an impressive list of Fortune 100 customers. We have engineering centres around the world in the US, APAC and EMEA. This role is to help us grow our European Centre of Excellence.

Join our software engineering team and utilize your software analysis and programming skills to enhance our existing products and build new ways to measure the Internet.

In your day-to-day you’ll learn, learn some more, and then you’ll keep learning. You’ll also design, deliver, mentor, and review—and repeat.

We have teams working on different stacks to measure the internet, crunch the data, and develop a beautiful portal which brings meaningful insights to our customers. If you think you might be a fit for any of these, we want to hear from you!

BENEFITS:

Catchpoint provides a wide range of benefits, including…

  • Full remote working with occasional (optional) travel to an office for company events
  • Competitive salary including performance bonus

WHAT YOU WILL BRING:

  • The ability to develop efficient and high quality software
  • A degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
  • Diverse and global teaming and collaboration
  • Effective communicator
  • Can quickly analyse, incorporate and apply new information and concepts
  • Ability to consistently make timely decisions even in the face of complexity, balancing systematic analysis with decisiveness
  • Ability to convey subtle or complex messages clearly, as appropriate for the topic and audience
  • Ability to code in multiple languages

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:

  • Strong coding and analytical skills
  • Experience of developing Enterprise Web Applications using React
  • Good Object Oriented Programming Experience
  • Knowledge and application of SOLID principles
  • Experience of full software lifecycle including Unit Testing and deployment.
  • Understanding of Data structures and Algorithms.
  • Willingness to learn and utilize emerging technologies

OVERVIEW:

Catchpoint is the Internet Resilience Company™.  The top online retailers, Global2000, CDNs, cloud service providers, and xSPs in the world rely on Catchpoint to increase their resilience by catching any issues in the Internet stack before they impact their business. The Catchpoint platform offers synthetics, RUM, performance optimization, high fidelity data and flexible visualizations with advanced analytics. It leverages thousands of global vantage points (including inside wireless networks, BGP, backbone, last mile, endpoint, enterprise, ISPs and more) to provide unparalleled observability into anything that impacts your customers, workforce, networks, website performance, applications and APIs..

Catchpoint is an equal opportunity employer that strongly prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of any kind. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive and engaging environment for all employees. We welcome applications from all candidates and look forward to receiving yours!
